propertyType.description: Entity Type may be used to categorize the entity's level in the entity hierarchy.
propertyType.name: Entity Type

propertyType.description: Use to indicate one or more contexts where this Business Entity is in scope.
propertyType.name: In Scope

propertyType.description: Executive Owner may be used to assign the highest level of responsibility for the entity.
propertyType.name: Executive Owner

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the person responsible for Compliance within this Business Entity.assign the highest level of responsibility for the entity.
propertyType.name: Compliance Owner

propertyType.description: Use to reference the location of the logo for this Business Entity.
propertyType.name: Logo URL

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the appetite for risk for this business entity and its children.
propertyType.name: Risk Appetite

propertyType.description: Additional Description may be used to provide HTML formatted information about the process/cycle.
propertyType.name: Additional Description

propertyType.description: Use to assign a person to the highest level of responsibility for this process or cycle.
propertyType.name: Process Owner

propertyType.description: Use to indicate which areas apply to this process.
propertyType.name: Domain

propertyType.description: Use to indicate one or more contexts where this Process is in scope.
propertyType.name: In Scope

propertyType.description: Use to indicate why the process is included in or excluded from scope.
propertyType.name: Audit Scope Rationale

propertyType.description: Use to indicate why the process is included in or excluded from scope.
propertyType.name: SOX Scope Rationale

propertyType.description: Use to enter or edit additional information about this action item.
propertyType.name: Additional Description

propertyType.description: Use to record the date when the work on this action item started.
propertyType.name: Start Date

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the date after which this issue action item is overdue.
propertyType.name: Due Date

propertyType.description: Use to set the expected completion date for this action item.
propertyType.name: Expected Completion Date

propertyType.description: Use to record the date when the work on this action item was actually completed.
propertyType.name: Actual Completion Date

propertyType.description: Use to assign a person ownership or responsibility for this action item.
propertyType.name: Assignee

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the progress of this action item. Enter a numeric value between 0 and 100.
propertyType.name: Percent Complete

propertyType.description: Use to enter or edit additional information about this issue.
propertyType.name: Additional Description

propertyType.description: Use to set the current status of this issue.
propertyType.name: Status

propertyType.description: Use to indicate which areas apply to this issue.
propertyType.name: Domain

propertyType.description: Use to assign a person ownership or responsibility for this issue.
propertyType.name: Assignee

propertyType.description: Use to identify the nature of the issue as it relates to the activity that initially generated the issue.
propertyType.name: Issue Type

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the person who identified the issue.
propertyType.name: Identified By Individual

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the group that identified the issue.
propertyType.name: Identified By Group

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the likelihood of this issue re-occurring.
propertyType.name: Probability

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the severity of the impact of the issue.
propertyType.name: Impact

propertyType.description: Use to objectively select the primary reason for the issue to have arisen.
propertyType.name: Root Cause Type

enumValue.name: Established business process not being followed
Established business process can be improved

propertyType.description: Use to subjectively describe the primary reason for the issue to have arisen.
propertyType.name: Root Cause Description

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the target date for closing this issue.
propertyType.name: Due Date

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the status of the resolution for this issue.
propertyType.name: Resolution Status

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the final outcome of this issue.
propertyType.name: Conclusion

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the level of urgency for this issue.
propertyType.name: Priority

propertyType.description: Use to enter or edit a summary of the management remediation plan for this issue.
propertyType.name: Management Response

propertyType.description: Use to enter or edit additional information about this risk.
propertyType.name: Additional Description

propertyType.description: Use to indicate which areas apply to this risk.
propertyType.name: Domain

propertyType.description: Use to assign a person ownership or responsibility for this risk.
propertyType.name: Owner

propertyType.description: Risk Sub-Category
propertyType.name: Risk Subcategory

propertyType.description: Use to indicate one or more contexts where this Risk is in scope.
propertyType.name: In Scope

propertyType.description: Use to indicate which financial statement assertions are affected by this risk.
propertyType.name: Financial Statement Assertions

propertyType.description: Use to enter or edit text that provides control designers with information about how this risk can be best mitigated.
propertyType.name: General Guidance

propertyType.description: Use to capture the degree of severity of the risk if not mitigated by adequate and effective controls.
propertyType.name: Inherent Impact

propertyType.description: Use to capture the severity of the risk after it is mitigated by adequate and effective controls. This value is used to compute the Residual Risk Rating field.
propertyType.name: Residual Impact

propertyType.description: Use to capture the probability of this risk occurring if not mitigated by adequate and effective controls.
propertyType.name: Inherent Likelihood

propertyType.description: Use to capture the probability of this risk occurring after it is mitigated by adequate and effective controls. This value is used to compute the Residual Risk Rating field.
propertyType.name: Residual Likelihood

propertyType.description: This is a read only field which is set to the combination of the Inherent Impact and Inherent Likelihood of this risk materializing.
propertyType.name: Inherent Risk Rating

propertyType.description: This is a read only field which is set to the combination of the Residual Impact and Residual Likelihood of this risk materializing.
propertyType.name: Residual Risk Rating

propertyType.description: Use to capture the degree of severity of the risk if not mitigated by adequate and effective controls. Use to capture the opinion of Internal Audit.
propertyType.name: Audit Inherent Impact

propertyType.description: Use to capture the severity of the risk after it is mitigated by adequate and effective controls. This value is used to compute the Audit Residual Risk Rating field. Use to capture the opinion of Internal Audit.
propertyType.name: Audit Residual Impact

propertyType.description: Use to capture the probability of this risk occurring if not mitigated by adequate and effective controls. Use to capture the opinion of Internal Audit.
propertyType.name: Audit Inherent Likelihood

propertyType.description: Use to capture the probability of this risk occurring after it is mitigated by adequate and effective controls. This value is used to compute the Audit Residual Risk Rating field. Use to capture the opinion of Internal Audit.
propertyType.name: Audit Residual Likelihood

propertyType.description: This is a read only field which is set to the combination of the Audit Inherent Impact and Audit Inherent Likelihood of this risk materializing.
propertyType.name: Audit Inherent Risk Rating

propertyType.description: This is a read only field which is set to the combination of the Audit Residual Impact and Audit Residual Likelihood of this risk materializing.
propertyType.name: Audit Residual Risk Rating

propertyType.description: Use to measure the number of times within a reporting year that this risk is likely to occur before controls are applied. Enter a numeric value. For example, the number 1 would indicate once a year, 2 for twice a year. This value is used to compute the Inherent Risk Exposure field.
propertyType.name: Inherent Frequency

propertyType.description: Use to measure the number of times within a reporting year that this risk is likely to occur after controls are applied. Enter a numeric value. For example, the number 1 would indicate once a year, 2 for twice a year. This value is used to compute the Residual Risk Exposure field.
propertyType.name: Residual Frequency

propertyType.description: Use to measure the amount of financial exposure or loss that could result from this risk before controls are applied. This value is used to compute the Inherent Risk Exposure field.
propertyType.name: Inherent Severity

propertyType.description: Use to measure the amount of financial exposure or loss that could result from this risk after controls are applied. This value is used to compute the Residual Risk Exposure field.
propertyType.name: Residual Severity

propertyType.description: This is a read only field which is set to the combination of the Inherent Frequency and Inherent Severity of this risk materializing.
propertyType.name: Inherent Risk Exposure

propertyType.description: This is a read only field which is set to the combination of the Residual Frequency and Residual Severity of this risk materializing.
propertyType.name: Residual Risk Exposure

propertyType.description: Use to indicate whether the residual risk is acceptable and if not what treatment is appropriate.
propertyType.name: Acceptance

propertyType.description: Use to indicate why the residual risk is accepted even though it may be above threshold.
propertyType.name: Reason for Acceptance

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the risk domain for this Risk.
propertyType.name: Functional Risk Area

propertyType.description: In the context of the relevant Baseline
propertyType.name: Baseline Risk Statement

propertyType.description: From the relevant Requirement
propertyType.name: Risk Statement

propertyType.description: As implemented in the business operations
propertyType.name: Implemented Risk Statement

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the control objective addressed by this Risk.
propertyType.name: Control Objective

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the highest category level for this Risk.
propertyType.name: Level 1 Category

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the second highest category level for this Risk.
propertyType.name: Level 2 Category

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the third highest category level for this Risk.
propertyType.name: Level 3 Category

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the fourth highest category level for this Risk.
propertyType.name: Level 4 Category

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the fifth highest category level for this Risk.
propertyType.name: Level 5 Category

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the sixth highest category level for this Risk.
propertyType.name: Level 6 Category

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the seventh highest category level for this Risk.
propertyType.name: Level 7 Category

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the eighth highest category level for this Risk.
propertyType.name: Level 8 Category

propertyType.description: Use to assign a person ownership or responsibility for this KRI.
propertyType.name: Owner

propertyType.description: This is a read only field which is calculated based upon the relationship between the two most recent KRI Values.
propertyType.name: Indicator Trend

propertyType.description: This is a read only field which is populated based upon the most recent KRI Value.
propertyType.name: Value

propertyType.description: This is a read only field which is populated based upon the most recent KRI Value.
propertyType.name: Value Date

propertyType.description: Use to enter or edit the origin of the data for this KRI.
propertyType.name: Data Source

propertyType.description: Use to indicate whether the indicator is deemed to be leading, lagging or a current indicator of risk.
propertyType.name: Nature

propertyType.description: Use to indicate how often the measurement data for this KRI is collected or gathered.
propertyType.name: Frequency

propertyType.description: Use to indicate how many days after the start of each period the KRI data should be collected.
propertyType.name: Frequency Offset Days

propertyType.description: Use to set the unit of measure for the threshold and target values.
propertyType.name: Unit of Measure

propertyType.description: Use to enter or edit a range of valid values for this KRI.
propertyType.name: Value Range

propertyType.description: Use to enter or edit any conditions, requirements, exclusions, or rules that apply to the calculation of the indicator value. For example, you could use this area to list an indicator value that includes everything of one class or type but excludes another class or type, or data that is required to be measured in a specific sequence or constructed over a given time period.
propertyType.name: Measurement Rules

propertyType.description: This field value is entered on the KRI Value and read only on the KRI.
propertyType.name: Collection Status

propertyType.description: This is a read only field calculated by comparing the Value with the Red and Yellow Thresholds, taking into account the Direction Information.
propertyType.name: Breach Status

propertyType.description: Use to indicate the meaning of directional trends in the values measured by this KRI. This field is read only on the KRI Value.
propertyType.name: Direction Information

propertyType.description: Use to enter a decimal value that represents the goal for this KRI (that is, what the company would have to achieve for normal functioning). Better than this value is Green; worse than this value is Yellow. This field is read only on the KRI Value.
propertyType.name: Yellow Threshold

propertyType.description: Use to enter a decimal value that represents a marginal level for this KRI. Better than this value is Yellow; worse than this value is Red. This field is read only on the KRI Value.
propertyType.name: Red Threshold

propertyType.description: Use to enter a decimal value that represents the most recent value for this indicator.
propertyType.name: Value

propertyType.description: Use to record the date on which this indicator was measured.
propertyType.name: Value Date

propertyType.description: Set this field to No to disable KRI Value triggers.
propertyType.name: Trigger Run

propertyType.description: Use to assign a person ownership or responsibility for this loss event.
propertyType.name: Owner

propertyType.description: Use to assign a person ownership or responsibility for signing off on this loss event.
propertyType.name: Approver

propertyType.description: Use to set the current status of this loss event.
propertyType.name: Status

propertyType.description: Use to indicate whether this loss event was a near miss or whether it resulted in a loss or gain.
propertyType.name: Outcome

propertyType.description: Use to enter or edit a description of the circumstances surrounding this loss event.
propertyType.name: What Happened

enumValue.name: Process - Inadequate delivery of outsourced activities
People - Lack of dealer roles and responsibilities
People - Deficient values, integrity and ethics
Systems - Unavailability and instability of systems
Systems - Lack of timely and relevant information
Systems - Inadequate data security and access
External - Key supplier and partner exposure
External - Unresponsive to legal/regulatory compliance changes
External - Physical asset misuse or theft

propertyType.description: Use to record the date when this loss event was discovered or noticed.
propertyType.name: Discovery Date

propertyType.description: Use to record the date when this loss event was recognized (in the GL).
propertyType.name: Recognition Date

propertyType.description: Use to record the first date when this loss event took place.
propertyType.name: Occurrence Date

propertyType.description: Use to record the last date when this loss event took place.
propertyType.name: Occurrence End Date

propertyType.description: This is a read only field calculated by subtracting the Recovery Amount from the Gross Loss.
propertyType.name: Net Loss

propertyType.description: This is a read only field calculated by adding the Actual Loss from all child Loss Impacts.
propertyType.name: Gross Loss

propertyType.description: This is a read only field calculated by adding the Actual Recovery Amount from all child Loss Recoveries.
propertyType.name: Recovery Amount

propertyType.description: This is a read only field calculated by adding the Estimated Loss from all child Loss Impacts.
propertyType.name: Estimated Gross Loss

propertyType.description: Use to enter or edit additional information about the impact of this loss.
propertyType.name: Additional Description

propertyType.description: Use to indicate which category applies to the loss resulting from this impact.
propertyType.name: Effect Category

propertyType.description: Use to indicate which subcategory applies to the loss resulting from this impact.
propertyType.name: Effect Subcategory

propertyType.description: Use to record the date when this loss impact took place.
propertyType.name: Occurrence Date

propertyType.description: Use to record the date when this loss impact was discovered or noticed.
propertyType.name: Discovery Date

propertyType.description: Use to enter an initial estimate of the magnitude of the loss.
propertyType.name: Estimated Loss

propertyType.description: Use to enter the actual magnitude of the loss.
propertyType.name: Actual Loss

propertyType.description: Set to No to disable Loss Impact triggers.
propertyType.name: Trigger Run

dependentValue.name: Process - Inadequate delivery of outsourced activities
Systems - Unavailability and instability of systems
Systems - Inadequate data security and access
Systems - Lack of timely and relevant information
People - Lack of dealer roles and responsibilities
People - Deficient values, integrity and ethics
External - Key supplier and partner exposure
External - Unresponsive to legal/regulatory compliance changes
External - Physical asset misuse or theft
